page.title: 02Costock
page.content: { Costock}can be found in the{Domesday {Book of 1086}under the name of{ {Cortingestocke.}It has since had several other names including{ {Cortlingstock}in 1211. Costock is a quiet little village with a main road running through it. There are two public houses and one of them is also an hotel.The hotel is called{The Red Lion}and the other is called{The Generous Briton.} In Costock there was a{Chapel}but it has been knocked down and is now used as parking space for one of the houses in{Chapel Lane.}There is also an old church called{St.Giles.} The biggest house in Costock is the Elizabethan{Manor House.
